item.title: Nicole add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Constancy in love is a good thing; but it means nothing, and is nothing, without constancy in every kind of effort." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Better to sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunk Christian." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "But when a man suspects any wrong it sometimes happens that if he be already involved in the matter he insensibly strives to cover up his suspicions even from himself. And much this way it was with me. I said nothing and tried to think nothing." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Elizabeth Kostova
item.description: "In the end, I always act from the heart, even if I also value reason and tradition. I wish I could explain why, but I don't know." -- Elizabeth Kostova

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worst kind of suffering." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Nicole add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Nicole add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Nabokov
item.description: "And then will come the day when the last person who remembers me will die." -- Nabokov

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Green
item.description: "...it occurred to me that the voracious ambition of humans is never sated by dreams coming true, because there is always the thought that everything might be done better and again." -- John Green
